summary: diseases are caused by different pathogens such as helminths, protists, bacteria, and viruses, which are the etiologic agents of diseases such as filariasis, leishmaniasis, babesiosis and dengue. among the most important insect vectors are mosquitos and sand flies from the genera Phlebotomus and Lutzomyia. the development of continuous insect cell lines has been an important tool for the study of insect biology. cell lines from Drosophila melanogaster (S2), Aedes albopictus (C6/36), and Anopheles gambie (Sua5B) have been employed to scrutinize diverse features of insect immunity. polyinosinic:polycytidylic acid (poly I:C) transfection was a synthetic analog of double-stranded RNA (Invitrogen) the mixtures were added to 8 107 LL5 cells for 24 h. supernatant was aspirated and stored after 24 h. more than 98% of cells were viable in all experiments. protease Inhibitor Cocktail 1 (Sigma) was added to the media. supernatants were centrifuged again at 10,000 g for 30 min. peptides were analyzed in triplicate by liquid chromatography tandem-mass spectrometry (LC-MS/MS) the peptides were analyzed in triplicate by liquid chromatography tandem-mass spectrometry (LC-MS/MS) Default parameters of the software were used for all analysis steps. proteins were searched against an L. longipalpis protein sequence database. peptide peaks were detected as three-dimensional features. protein signal peptide (SP) from 304 proteins was estimated. qPCR Real-time polymerase chain reaction (qPCR) was performed using SYBR Green PCR Master Mix. expression levels were determined through 2(-Delta Delta C(T) method (DDCt) [34], normalized using rp49 gene expression [35], yielding relative expression value. 3′ BTF3-R 5′TACGTCGCCACCGAAATGAGTT3′ Juvenile hormone-inducible protein supernatant was aspirated and stored after 24 h. transfected and mock-transfected cells were collected after 6, 12, 24, and 48 h incubations. more than 98% of cells were viable in all experiments. the samples were digested in 50 mM ABC with trypsin (Promega, cat. V5113, Madison, WI, USA) before trypsinization, the samples were digested in 50 mM ABC with trypsin (Promega, cat. V5113, Madison, WI, USA) after trypsinization, trifluoroacetic acid was added to a final concentration of 0.5%. the ten most intense ions were sequentially isolated and fragmented in the linear ion trap using collision-induced dissociation at a target value of 30,000. the “lock mass” option was enabled at 445.120025 m/z in all full scans to improve mass accuracy of precursor ions. the supernatant was removed 6, 12, 24, and 48 h post-transfection. the cells, after being washed three times with PBS, were resuspended in 1 mL of TRizol (Ambion, Waltham, MA, USA) the RNA was extracted following the manufacturer’s instructions. TCTTTGCCATT3′ LCAT-R 5′TGCCAGGGATGGGGATGTAATTTG3′ Scramblase SCR-F 5′GATTGACAGCGCAATGGACGATAG3′ Basic transcription factor 3 BTF3-F 5′AGTGCATAAGCAGGCAACACCA3′ BTF3-R 5′TACGTCGCCACCGAAATGAGTT3′ Juvenile hormone-inducible protein JHIP-F 5′ antigen PCNA-F 5′CATGAATCTCGACCAGGAGCACTT3′ PCNA-R 5′TCACGGCAAATGCGTGCAAA3′ Tubulin-specific chaperone A TBCA-R 5′CTTCCTCTCGCGTGTTCAT3′ Ribosomal protein 49 rp49-F 5′GACCGATATGCCAAGCTAAAGCA3′ rp49-R 5′GGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGG dsRNA-mediated non-specific antiviral response was observed in two members of the Apidae family. dsRNA is recognized by the PRR retinoic acid-inducible gene 1 (RIG-I) and the melanoma differentiation-associated protein (MDA5) in vertebrates. the transcription factors induce type-I interferon (IFN) and pro-inflammatory cytokine production. dsRNA, including poly I:C, is also detected by toll-like receptor 3, initiating the type-I interferon signaling pathway via a toll/interleukin-1 receptor (TIR)-domain-containing adapter-inducing interferon- (TRIF) signal, which activates interferon receptor factor 3 (IRF-3) and nuclear factor B ( we performed an interaction analysis of the LL5 dsRNA-transfected exoproteome. the network analysis of 304 proteins predicted 271 proteins were connected by 2184 edges forming an intricate network. the prevised protein interaction p-value was 0.0. the STRING interactome maps were generated using default settings. proteins were represented as nodes and their functional links were defined by solid lines. no additional interplay proteins were added to the networks. the complete FDR-filtered (p 0.05) lists are shown in Table S3. LL5 cells protein secretion behavior in response to dsRNA treatment. white squares represent the proteins’ relative amount variation at 24-h after transfection. phospholipid scramblase 1 (PLSCR1) had a positive variation with a greater than 8-fold change at both time points. in insects this enzyme is related to detoxifying processes, including insecticide resistance. hexameric chaperone complex prefoldin (PFD) has been found to be associated with cellular response. PFDN1 expression was positively modulated in both hepatitis C virus-infected HEK 293 cells and in the RABV-infected N2a cells [59,60]. PFDN2 was directly bound to the hepatitis C virus (HCV) F protein [61]. PFDN2 was found directly bound to the hepatitis C virus (HCV) F protein. ACE2 cells led to a decrease in the severe acute respiratory syndrome–coronavirus replication. we identified two juvenile hormone-inducible proteins at 24 h. the juvenile hormone itself and retinoic acid are terpenoids, with similar structure and biological effects in mammalian and insect cells. the barrier to autointegration factor (BAF) DNA binding protein had an increase of 2.65-fold at 24 h. this protein is described as potent antiviral effector against poxyviruses, retroviruses and the herpes virus. qPCR analysis of 13 genes coding for significantly positive- or negatively-modulated secreted proteins revealed the existence of some genes with transcriptional profile correlated with the amount of protein detected in the supernatants. there were seven molecules that presented a correlation between mRNA and secreted protein levels. fected group (horizontal traced line) normalized to the rp49 reference gene. quantification was normalized relative to the house keeping gene rp49. bars represent mean with standard error (SEM) of two biological replicates. at 48 h post transfection the secreted protein levels decreased drastically regardless of changes in mRNA levels prior to this time point. basal transcription factor 3 (BTF3) has been reported to play a significant role in the transcriptional regulation related to eukaryote growth and development. the exoproteome of human hepatic cells infected with the chikungunya virus was analyzed. mRNA levels obtained from qPCR were plotted on X-axis. mRNA levels obtained from qPCR were plotted on the Y-axis. the exosomal secretory pathway is the major LL5 cell secretion mechanism in this response. this non-specific antiviral response is in a way similar to an interferon-like response mediated by the Toll pathway.
